cluster_relations.rel_desc: Human communication in contemporary society is situated within today's digital age.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Links a historical or societal era to a phenomenon or practice that is situated within that era as its contextual backdrop.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: today's era of widespread digital technologies

remarks: Relation mainly encodes temporal/era context; borderline between context and intrinsic property.
Relation mainly encodes temporal/era context; borderline between context and intrinsic property.
Relation mainly encodes temporal/era context; borderline between context and intrinsic property.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Social media is framed as a defining and prevalent feature of today's digital age.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Links a phenomenon, practice, or technology to an era in which it is widespread, characteristic, or defining.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Context: widespread use of digital technologies and online connectivity

remarks: Relation mainly encodes era-context; semantics partly overlap with broader societal context.
Relation mainly encodes era-context; semantics partly overlap with broader societal context.
Relation mainly encodes era-context; semantics partly overlap with broader societal context.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Individuals become more informed about and engaged in current events.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that individuals actively engage with, pay attention to, or interact around a particular topic or set of current events.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Social Media and Online Social Interaction
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: EngagementType: being more informed and actively engaged

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Democratization of information sparks important conversations.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a causal factor that brings about or gives rise to the object.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Democratization of information leads to debates on social issues.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a causal factor that brings about or gives rise to the object.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Important conversations are about social issues.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a communicative act or discourse instance is thematically about or centered on a given topic or issue.
remarks: Prepositional phrase applies to both conversations and debates; here modeled for conversations.
Prepositional phrase applies to both conversations and debates; here modeled for conversations.
Prepositional phrase applies to both conversations and debates; here modeled for conversations.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Debates on social issues are thematically centered on those social issues.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a communicative act or discourse instance is thematically about or centered on a given topic or issue.

args.justification: The relation 'engages_with_topic' describes active interaction between individuals and information (current events), which fits better under a broad INTERACTION group than USAGE (typically more tool-/resource-oriented). Adjusting rel_cls_group improves alignment with other engagement/interaction predicates in the schema without changing the canonical predicate or class.

executed_decisions.justification: The relation 'engages_with_topic' describes active interaction between individuals and information (current events), which fits better under a broad INTERACTION group than USAGE (typically more tool-/resource-oriented). Adjusting rel_cls_group improves alignment with other engagement/interaction predicates in the schema without changing the canonical predicate or class.
